intro: Cochlearia nilotica, commonly known as the Egyptian cochlearia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean and parts of Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar characteristics. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically lobed and can vary in shape depending on the growing conditions. Cochlearia nilotica is often found in coastal areas and can thrive in sandy or rocky soils.
